de.larssh.utils.text

Class StringConverters

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.larssh.utils.text.StringConverters

  • public final class StringConverters
extends Object
    This class contains helper methods for decoding and encoding strings.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • decodeBase64

        public static String decodeBase64(String value)
        Decodes value as Base64 string.

        This method is equivalent to using Base64.getDecoder() with the char set Strings.DEFAULT_CHARSET.

        Parameters:
        value - the value to be decoded
        Returns:
        the decoded value

      • decodeBase64Mime

        public static String decodeBase64Mime(String value)
        Decodes value using the Base64 MIME type decoding scheme.

        This method is equivalent to using Base64.getMimeDecoder() with the char set Strings.DEFAULT_CHARSET.

        Parameters:
        value - the value to be decoded
        Returns:
        the decoded value

      • decodeBase64Url

        public static String decodeBase64Url(String value)
        Decodes value as Base64 URL and filename-safe string.

        This method is equivalent to using Base64.getUrlDecoder() with the char set Strings.DEFAULT_CHARSET.

        Parameters:
        value - the value to be decoded
        Returns:
        the decoded value

      • decodeCsv

        public static Csv decodeCsv(String data,
                            char separator,
                            char escaper)
        Parses the CSV data given by data.

        To process Reader input, refer to Csv.parse(Reader, char, char).

        Parameters:
        data - the CSV input data
        separator - the CSV separator character
        escaper - the CSV escaping character
        Returns:
        an object representing the parsed CSV data
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - on illegal separator or escaper value

      • decodeUrl

        public static String decodeUrl(String value)
                        throws ParseException
        Decodes an application/x-www-form-urlencoded string.

        This method is equivalent to using URLDecoder.decode(String) with the char set StandardCharsets.UTF_8 as the World Wide Web Consortium Recommendation states that UTF-8 should be used.

        Parameters:
        value - the value to be decoded
        Returns:
        the decoded value
        Throws:
        ParseException - on illegal or incomplete hex characters

      • encodeBase64

        public static String encodeBase64(String value)
        Translates value into Base64 format.

        This method is equivalent to using Base64.getEncoder() with the char set Strings.DEFAULT_CHARSET.

        Parameters:
        value - the value to be encoded
        Returns:
        the encoded value

      • encodeBase64Mime

        public static String encodeBase64Mime(String value)
        Translates value into Base64 MIME type encoding scheme.

        This method is equivalent to using Base64.getMimeEncoder() with the char set Strings.DEFAULT_CHARSET.

        Parameters:
        value - the value to be encoded
        Returns:
        the encoded value

      • encodeBase64Url

        public static String encodeBase64Url(String value)
        Translates value into Base64 URL and filename-safe format.

        This method is equivalent to using Base64.getUrlEncoder() with the charset Strings.DEFAULT_CHARSET.

        Parameters:
        value - the value to be encoded
        Returns:
        the encoded value

      • encodeCsv

        public static String encodeCsv(Collection<? extends Collection<String>> data,
                               char separator,
                               char escaper)
        Encodes data as CSV document. Occurrences of special characters are encoded using escaper and values are separated using separator.

        For more information on single value escaping see encodeCsvValue(String, char, char).

        Parameters:
        data - the data to be encoded
        separator - the CSV separator character
        escaper - the CSV escaping character
        Returns:
        the encoded CSV document

      • encodeCsvRow

        public static String encodeCsvRow(Collection<? extends String> values,
                                  char separator,
                                  char escaper)
        Encodes values as one CSV row. Occurrences of special characters are encoded using escaper and values are separated using separator.

        For more information on single value escaping see encodeCsvValue(String, char, char).

        Parameters:
        values - the values to be encoded
        separator - the CSV separator character
        escaper - the CSV escaping character
        Returns:
        the encoded CSV row

      • encodeCsvValue

        public static String encodeCsvValue(String value,
                                    char separator,
                                    char escaper)
        Encodes value into a single CSV value. All occurrences of escaper are escaped (doubled). If value contains inappropriate characters, it is surrounded by escaper.

        Inappropriate characters are '\r', '\n', escaper and separator. The latter is used for the list of inappropriate characters only.

        Examples:

        Examples
        Parameter Return Value
        EMPTY EMPTY
        abc abc
        abc"xyz "abc""xyz"
        " """"
        Parameters:
        value - the value to be encoded
        separator - the CSV separator character
        escaper - the CSV escaping character
        Returns:
        the encoded value

      • encodeUrl

        public static String encodeUrl(String value)
        Translates a string into application/x-www-form-urlencoded format with the char set StandardCharsets.UTF_8 as the World Wide Web Consortium Recommendation states that UTF-8 should be used.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to be encoded
        Returns:
        the encoded value
